title: Love Island's Molly-Mae Hague brands her mum 'savage' as she jokes she's 'put on six stone'
text:
Molly-Mae Hague branded her mum Debbie 'savage' as she jokingly tore into her personal appearance.

The Love Island star, 20, took to Instagram on Sunday to share a clip of Debbie hurling insults at her, saying she had 'ugly small hands, podgy knees and has put on six stone since leaving the villa'.

It seems Molly-Mae's mum was making light of the extreme trolling the social media influencer has had since rising to fame on the hit ITV2 show.

Banter: Molly-Mae Hague branded her mum Debbie 'savage' as she jokingly tore into her personal appearance (pictured yesterday)

Debbie hit out at some of the cruel taunts her daughter had received on Instagram as she reeled off: 'Podgy knees, fat, put on six stone since leaving the villa. Ugly, literally ugly, ugly small hands with no brain.'

Molly-Mae captioned the video: 'She kills me. And you guys all thought she was savage to me in the villa... this is just the way we are.'

Back in August, Molly-Mae was said to have had a series of therapy sessions during her six day digital detox after facing such vitriol from trolls online.

Meanwhile, the blonde bombshell's boyfriend Tommy Fury, 20, revealed he's ready to start trying for children with Molly-Mae.

Speaking while making an appearance with Molly-Mae on her YouTube channel, the handsome boxer opened up about their months-long romance, before revealing plans to welcome the patter of tiny feet in less than two years.

Fielding a host of questions sent to the couple via Instagram, Molly-Mae responded when asked about starting a family: 'We both definitely want children. But obviously we're both only 20 years old.'

However, Tommy – whose older brother is fellow boxer Tyson Fury – quickly interjected: 'We've been trying to make children most nights.'

While his claims were met with denials by his blonde girlfriend, Tommy pressed on: 'Yes, we have. We've been snoodling in the bedroom, I want twins by the time I'm 22, simple as that... Molly wants six kids, I want eight.'
